data.title: 1891 census, army East India
data.meta_description:
I am trying to locate William Samuel White, born 1868 in Oldbury Worcestershire. 
I am unable to find him in the 1891 census (rest of family found) 
His army Record shows that he was posted to East Indies 1891 - 1901, but I do not know the actual date. 
 
Well that's the background now the question 
 
Would army personnel serving abroad be counted within the census and if so how would I be able to find the entry? 
How would I be able to find the actual date of departure to the East Indies?
data.text:
I am trying to locate William Samuel White, born 1868 in Oldbury Worcestershire.

I am unable to find him in the 1891 census (rest of family found)

His army Record shows that he was posted to East Indies 1891 - 1901, but I do not know the actual date.

Well that's the background now the question

Would army personnel serving abroad be counted within the census and if so how would I be able to find the entry?

How would I be able to find the actual date of departure to the East Indies?

Thanks, Wendy

Hi Wendy

If you have a look at image 38397 of his record on Ancestry - you will see the exact dates for his service in the East Indies (ie Indian subcontinent then) - 2/1/91 to 12/11/96 - but be aware this includes the journey by boat out and back to India

Looks like he was with 1st Battalion Worcestershire Regiment - have you seen this website -

https://www.

worcestershireregiment.com/index.php

They have some great old photos of the battalion

https://www.

worcestershireregiment.com/wr.php?main=inc/bat_1_1881

Cheers

Sue

Sorry Wendy for not making it clearer - as this appeared to be the only record online for him I presumed (I know - never presume anything!) this was what you were looking at.

The early pages (covering his WW1 service) just give years served overseas - but if you plough through (Ancestry say there are only 4 pages for him - in fact there are a few more - can't remember exactly how many more) you get to this page with the details of his earlier service
